Reviews.Title: Good TV for the technologically challenged
Reviews.Author: A. Young
Reviews.Content: I was in the market to replace the 15-inch Magnavox TV I'd had in my bedroom for six years (and at which I had to squint if I got more than a couple feet away from it). I knew I wanted a TV that was at least 24", but I didn't want to break my wallet on it. I researched different brands and comparison-shopped online with Amazon, Best Buy, Sears, and Target, at long last settling on this Sharp 26" LED TV. It was priced at just $229 when I bought it, so I figured it'd be hard to go wrong with a 1080p-capable, 26", name-brand set. Here's a rundown of the features that were relevant to me in buying and what I thought of them out of the box:EASE OF USEI am no technophile. Too many different-colored cords and inputs and outputs and buttons and tiny jacks tax my poor brain easily to the point of tears (which are inevitably followed by Office Space-esque rage and threats of throwing electronics out the window). Ergo, I wanted a set that was easy to assemble and program. The initial setup on this TV was a breeze thanks to a step-by-step process that initiates as soon as you power up the set for the first time. I also bought this TV with the intention of mostly watching DVDs and streaming videos with a Roku player, and the very clearly labeled inputs and outputs made plugging in my components a simple, rage-free process.PICTUREThe best thing that this Sharp TV has going for it is that the picture is indeed true to the product name: Sharp. First, I hooked up my DVD player to the AV component inputs. The picture was clear, bright, and easily viewable from the other side of my bedroom (about 10' away), and the TV's simple-to-use menus made it easy for me to fool around with the contrast, brightness, and saturation settings as well as to try out the picture on preset options (for my purposes, the Movie setting looked the best). So far, so good. I then hooked up my Roku 2 XD Streaming Player 1080p with an HDMI cable. I should mention that this was my first personal experience using an HDMI hookup, which I opted for mainly because it cut down on the number of cords required to hook up the Roku. Still, I was not totally sure what to expect. After I connected the Roku and completed the initial setup, I began streaming... and it was like seeing Mecca or the great Sequoia for the first time. Just WOW. The HD on this set is absolutely brilliant. I had thought that the standard DVD quality was nice, but the HD was breathtaking.SOUNDThe reviews of the sound on this set were the one point that gave me pause before I bought it, but most lower-priced flatscreens have the "tin can audio" problem -- and again, for $229, I figured I was not going to do much better. Honestly, the sound is not great, but nor do I find it totally unlistenable. I played around with the sound settings and found that the quality was much improved by turning up the bass, switching to the Live preset, and enabling the Surround Sound setting; that gave the sound a fuller quality than the default settings. It's still not awesome, but it's not so bad that I regret my purchase. I also often watch TV with noise-reducing headphones, which definitely helps round out the sound, and I actually have some old monitor speakers that I may try out with the set as well -- they've enabled many a rockin' dance party to be had off my usually barely-audible laptop, so I'm betting they could do this TV a solid, too.*UPDATE* Shortly after I wrote this review, I purchased the Altec Lansing BXR1220 2.0 Speakers (my review is here: http://www.amazon.com/review/R207MEV7BLUH30/ref=cm_cr_rdp_perm) and tried them out with this TV. What a difference! They even out and improve the sound considerably, and when I bought them, Amazon was selling them for just $11. They are nice and compact and don't take up much space at all, and since they can be powered by the USB outlet on the TV, they power off with the TV. Definitely worth the few bucks extra!OVERALLThis is a good set for the price: easy to set up, excellent picture, and sound that can be lived with if you're willing to adapt. For this technophobe's money, it was definitely worth buying!

Reviews.Title: EZ
Reviews.Author: wanda
Reviews.Content: quick setup, used 1 hdmi cable. connected to directv and wired to internet. sound was a little tinny, but fixed that with nice audio menu. great bedroom tv.excellent picture, no issues there.i would recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Picture's great, sound is awful
Reviews.Author: MamaKat
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom.  The size and picture are great, but the sound is awful.  It sounds like it's coming from a tin can.  I have played with the audio menu and brought it from a score of 1 (out of 10) to a 2, but it is still terrible.  I will HAVE to purchase additional speakers.  When my husband is watching it I keep thinking he's listening to the answering machine.  That's what it sounds like.  Like a really bad/cheap audio recording.  Sports are the worst.  There's just no oomph to it, no fullness, just flat tinny sound.  I bought it because Sharp is as close to "Made in America" as you can get and that is important to me.  The picture is great, setup was easy and the size is perfect for us.  I would  recommend this TV to a friend, but only with the warning that they will want to purchase additional speakers for the audio.

Reviews.Title: Dead on arrival
Reviews.Author: ChrisL
Reviews.Content: The first model received only displayed a bright white screen. Amazon sent out an RMA and a replacement model that works as advertised, but this is the first time I've seen a bad from the factory TV like this.The telephone support from sharp was great except they misinformed us of the support details. They initially said someone would come out to check the unit then called back to say we'd have to bring it back in (which is why we just returned it).Overall, the picture looks great on HDMI (the reason for the 4 star review) - just be aware that you might get a bad unit too. A completely solid state device shouldn't have made it out of factory testing with this type of error.

Reviews.Title: You've Been Warned
Reviews.Author: Robert Sumner
Reviews.Content: If you will only watch this TV from level or slightly above and from a single centered fixed chair position, ever, you will love the picture.  Otherwise don't even consider the Sharp LC26SV49OU.  I own multiple LCD sets and have never seen anything with this narrow of a viewing angle.  Side to side is poor, but even 2 degrees below vertical and this set is unwatchable.  I called Sharp and they finally told me, yes, we've had complaints.  I returned it.  You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: Almost 5 stars 4.75
Reviews.Author: David Budlong "President, Ace Handyman Servic...
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my office, I needed at least 3 HDMI ports and 1080 resolution since one of the funtions I am using it for is a computer monitor. The 1080 resolution allows 1920x1080 resolution, 720 does not. The TV took about 5 minutes to remove from box and set up. Very simple menu items, which is why i only give it 4.75 stars. I would like to label each input with my own labels, such as Computer, Blu-Ray, and Cable.Great picture and sound is adequate with a few adjustments.I replaced a Dynex LCD TV with this one because the Dynex only had 2 HDMI inputs and the viewing angles were terrible, unless you were straight on, the picture was dark. The Sharp has great viewing angles making it a great all purpose set.For the price this is a great LED/LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV -- sound is BLAH!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Cartolano
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the positive remarks about this tv.  The picture is great and the size is just right as a bedroom tv or for that matter a kitchen/dining area tv.  The sound is at best BLAH!!!!!!!!!  It is tinny and shallow and no adjustments make it better.  What I did was I bought the Logitech usb laptop Z305 speaker and the sound is beautiful!  It is full bodied, clear and plenty loud. The speaker is powered by the usb port of the tv.  The only thing is that when the tv is powered on you have to power on the speaker by pressing the power button on the speaker.  It's not the most desirable setup but it works and the speaker makes the tv all the more excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: M. Haney "Almost New"
Reviews.Content: Offered @ $229.00 in Jan 2012 with no tax or shipping, the item was irresistible. The sound is not so bad if you adjust to "Surround Sound" and "Live" in the audio menu. Full bass is Ok but not necessary. Since I had an unused PC audio system with sub-wolfer that I could plug into the the headphone jack, the sound is now excellent. As for the picture, there is a a "smart" video adjustment that alters all signals to optimize the 26" screen for all inputs. The full 1080, 120 screen was great for the super bowl. I am completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: No good as a computer monitor.
Reviews.Author: Just Some Guy
Reviews.Content: I bought this because another reviewer here said how amazing this was as a computer monitor.I say: You need your eyes testing mate!!This is no good at all as a computer monitor.  The picture is very soft making text very tiresome to read.  We tired almost every trick in the book and couldn't make it acceptable.Returned for refund.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Lousy Sound
Reviews.Author: LittleSpender
Reviews.Content: Picture is bright and clear although the viewing angle from above and below is limited.  Sound is tinny - must be using tiny speakers because increasing the base doesn't help.  Good TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: great picture, tinny sound
Reviews.Author: coolplants
Reviews.Content: The picture is great- clear, sharp (I haven't run it though my setup DVD routine, so I just reduced the factory sharpness setting), has all the inputs I need.  I have it running from rabbit-ears in an area where cable is not an option.  Built-in tuner works as well as the old external digital tuner box.  I hooked up my external computer speakers (powered, with small subwoofer) to get decent sound.  The built-in speakers are laughably bad.  Tinny is an appropriate adjective for the sound.  No low-range whatsoever, and not much high-end, either.  If you buy the TV, please plan on buying external computer speakers.  Plug into the earphone jack (standard 3.5mm plug), turn up the volume on your external speakers and you can then control volume from the TV remote.  Works fine for me.  Being 60Mh rather than 120, there is a slight blurriness on high-speed movement, but it is really not noticeable most of the time.  I am very happy with it, given the external speaker setup.  4 stars instead of 5 because of the poor built-in speakers.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: AV Kevin
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to go with a little surround system and the weak audio was not a concern for me. The built in sound is pretty tinny but that's not unusual for a flat panel TV, especially in this size range. With a little tweaking the picture looks great. A lot of the differences that some may be seeing in picture quality has as much to do with the source as the TV. If you are on cable or satellite, the picture is compressed and you'll lose some of the resolution. Even the channel selection will have a lot to do with picture quality. I use Discovery channel as a reference because they have one of the best 1080 signals around. If you use this with an antenna for local TV, the picture will be even better since it's no longer compressed. My main complaint, and it's common for most manufacturers, is the bezel around the TV is glossy black and reflects any light near your viewing position. It can be distracting during dark scenes. If you're concerned with sound quality, use a set of computer style speakers or even a home theater in a box. Anything will do a better job than most TV speakers anyway. I do wish it had more component inputs and an analog audio out. I turned off the internal speakers and set the volume around 50%, then fed the headphone output into my surround system. That way when I'm not using the cable box, I can still get audio into the surround system. As for the component input, they are basically outdated now and with 3 HDMI inputs, this TV should be more than sufficient for a while.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Phyllis L. Filter
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in January and have not had any issues. Great picture. I would definitely buy another if needed. I like the fact it has a headphone jack so I can watch TV in bed and not wake up the better half.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: Novice pc user
Reviews.Content: great picture-sound a little "tinny", but when hooked up to speakers is great.  would recommend to a friend who is looking to replace old secondary tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: TMB
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my teenage son for his gaming, he wanted the 1080p as his games come through in HD.  I almost did not purchase it, because many of the reviews mentioned the sound not being all that great, and I do like to see exactly what a picture looks like prior to a TV purchase, but it was for Christmas, the price was good, and I didn't want to fight the crowds late in the season.  The TV is perfect and my son is picky when it comes to playing his games.  The picture is great, and the sound is fine.  I would actually purchase another one to update the TV in my bedroom.  Delivery was right on schedule, and a much less stressful process than plowing through the stores.  I would give it 5 stars, but I rarely give anything like this a "perfect" rating, as I like to see how it lasts over time.

Reviews.Title: A very good deal for the money
Reviews.Author: Bob C. from Florida
Reviews.Content: My Sharp 26' TV is as good as advertised, especially for the excellent price that I paid. The picture is sharp and clear.  It goes well in my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Met Expectations
Reviews.Author: CaptMorgan "SkidRow"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for home office, used 8-10 hours per day with stock channels running. Used HDMI. The tinty sound and other complaints were corrected easily by going into menu and changing settings.(Sharp should know better and set different defaults). I think the sound is great, certainly has the volume. Set up took 10 minutes. Did play with all the settings. Typical poor commander, with channel buttons not always responding. Great Sharp picture as expected, with black particularly good. Hooked to cable. Have a Sharp 52, so this met expectations. Who knows with electrical products? May catch on fire tomorrow. It was shipped in it's box, and arrived almost scarless. Flawless transaction. If you don't have HDMI cable, there like cheap now. Only negative is inability to tilt. Supposedly best time to buy is just after the Super Bowl, who knows?

Reviews.Title: sound
Reviews.Author: Joe D
Reviews.Content: The picture was great but the sound quality was terrible, I returned the TV immediately, I do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Be conscious with the LED
Reviews.Author: kiikeepr
Reviews.Content: The tv picture is really nice. The tv case is very very thin. Like all the LED....  This is why in most of them the sound isn't loud and crisp. (This is my second LED and the first one is a 32" VIZIO and has the same issue). I think this is to keep the tv in a low budget range.In the sound menu the "LIVE" option was the best one.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Velho
Reviews.Content: I may have gotten a defective unit, but in any case the picture was extremely washed out. Adjusting the picture controls--contrast, brightness, etc. made no difference in the picture. I returned the unit and got a Samsung for a bit more money and a much better picture. I have one of the very first Sharp flat screens and it still works great with a good picture so that was the reason I purchased this Sharp unit. As noted, I may have gotten a defective unit.

Reviews.Title: every thing promised
Reviews.Author: telling it how it is
Reviews.Content: The TV was ordered on a Friday and arrived Tuesday, very fast shipping for the standard "free shipping". Sharp makes wonderful TV's and this shows it. It is not as great as my Sharp Aquas but as a second TV it is great. There is no other company I trust more, "based of experience and friend/family consensus". You will not be disappoint in this "boob tube."

Reviews.Title: nice tv
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: this tv  is the perfect size for our kitchen . it has a great picture and sound for a tv  in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Awsome TV/Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: Christopher S. Mooney "Moondawg"
Reviews.Content: This TV is an incredible value for the price.  The screen is fantastic. I used it to replace two CRTs, a 20" television and a 19" CRT computer monitor.  What a space-saver!  The 1080p is hardly necessary in this size-screen for watching TV, but it is very useful as a computer monitor because it allows more information to be diplayed at once and decreased the need to page-down for internet news stories, PDF files, and other documents.The sound seems more than adequate for a TV.  Ummmmm, "tinny" ???  If that's your hangup, then buy a modest sound system to go with it!

Reviews.Title: awsome value
Reviews.Author: Cmoney
Reviews.Content: crystal clear picture in 1080 has lots of hdmi inputs has loud and clear sound nice easy to use menus and remote best deal for the money by far DONT SETTLE FOR 720 YOU WILL REGRET ITbest in this price bracket hands down

Reviews.Title: TV easily rates 5 stars; audio gets 4
Reviews.Author: ware adams
Reviews.Content: As a TV, the picture quality is as good as it gets; and the options available surpass most offerings. The sound quality is average, and that's not surprising from a 26" flat screen..  But, when this TV is attached to a quality sound bar, you have the best of both worlds. With a good sound bar, this TV easily deserves a top 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Great price for the LED TV.
Reviews.Author: oilman
Reviews.Content: Great price for the LED TV. Perfect size for my bed room with external speakers it's sounds really good  now

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: myaari
Reviews.Content: It is so good that I am looking for another one just like it at the same price and so far I have not found any.  Clear image, well I am glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: El Doug
Reviews.Content: This TV is perfect for a bedroom or a workout room.  I have it hooked up to an OTA antenna and to my computer in a workout room.  Picture quality is great.  Sound is all you can really expect from a 26" TV and fills my workout room without issue.Also, one thing that rarely gets mentioned, but this TV has a really natural menu that was easy to program the OTA channels.  Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Edward T. Geha
Reviews.Content: Yes, the sound isn't great.  But that didn't matter much to me, as it's just an extra TV.  It's not standing alone in the middle of a giant room with 20 people around it, watching a game.  So the fact that it doesn't have astonishing sound doesn't really bother me.  What does bother me, though, is that with such a slim design, it has a circular piece at the bottom (to connect to the stand if using it) that sticks out past any other part of the back of the TV.  Therefore, with the low-profile mount I have, it will not press all the way up against the wall.  It sticks out at the bottom.  Kind of annoying - a bit of a design flaw.  But overall, good quality, good picture.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey
Reviews.Content: Very good product, works very well, easy to set up as far as speakers go ,, there is not one manufacture who makes TVs sound good ,, so just plug in some speakers and there you go Theater sound

Reviews.Title: Good product!
Reviews.Author: E. Mott
Reviews.Content: I am using this as a "shared" monito for two PC's and also as a TV. PC's are on HDMI inputs, and TV is on COX. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Gabbs
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat screen TV and I only wanted a nice sized one for me to watch. I like it alot and haven't had any problems so far. After reading alot of reviews for TVs on Amazon, I am confident that I found the right TV for me.

Reviews.Title: Good as advertised
Reviews.Author: Ray Schapker
Reviews.Content: The TV has a very good picture, and good sound. The only slight drawback is the remote.  I wish it had more favorites on it. You have to punch in 5 numbers on some channels with my cable service.  If I more favorites I could just hit the favorite button.

Reviews.Title: Weak Sound and Sports are unwatchable...
Reviews.Author: Rayce
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I don't review many consumer products because most of what I buy has been vetted by others and I don't want to waste time agreeing with everyone...  That being said, I'd like to let everyone know that this is a mediocre television at best and here's why.  1. I don't know what the "Hz's" are for this TV because they successfully hide this stat but when I watch any type of sporting event, the players are really blurry when they move.  So much so, that I would rather watch a game on my old 19" CRT TV than this one.  2.  The sound is tinny and the volume is very weak.  Most of the time we need to have it up to 70-80/100 which starts to distort the sound.Other than that the TV is fine.  The picture is good for the news and most other things but if you ever want to watch a sporting event, look elsewhere...

Reviews.Title: Sharp 26" TV review
Reviews.Author: Graywolf
Reviews.Content: The largest screen size that we could fit into our equipment cabinet was 26". There were many model to chose from, but the Sharp 26" had the resolution that we wanted, 1080P. The setup was extremely simple, I like the feature where we could choose "store" or "home". Obviously "store" settings have have the color and brightness settings far above normal home settings because of lighting in the stores. Some reviewers have stated that the sound was "tinny", I did not find this to be the case, but we have changed the inputs to my A/V receiver, so the TV speakers are non issue. I also liked the fact that the Component Input on the rear of the TV has the ability to use the Cr for just Video input when Component inputs are not available, as is the case from my older A/V Receiver which just has S-video and Composite. The picture quality is very good, the menue is easy to use as is the remote. For a 26" TV, you can't go wrong with this TV. Made in America

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: It's an excellent product, the images are very good quality; I enjoyed watching movies and TV and the sound is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Shart TV
Reviews.Author: Rosita Herrick "Cardinal Fan"
Reviews.Content: Shipment arrived on time and I was amazed at how light the TV was. For my old TV I needed 2 persons to lift. It installed like a dream, just remove the cable from the old one and attach to the new one. Plug it in and it works.The image is clear and sharp.

Reviews.Title: Bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Beach Feet "Beach Feet"
Reviews.Content: Fair picture and sound quality.  I returned it to Amazon for a larger and far better LG for only $69 more.  Amazon did an excellent job of handling the return, without questions asked (hold on to all packaging, etc.).Don't buy this one, in spite of the low price.  An LG or Samsung gives you much more quality for the money.

Reviews.Title: Sharp LC26Sv490U
Reviews.Author: RAY THACKERY
Reviews.Content: Color auto adjustment for dark rooms has funny effect somewhat like a halo around items on the screen.  Faces show an unusual coloring when viewed in low external lighting situations.

Reviews.Title: Sharp is not the brand to buy...
Reviews.Author: Ronald J. Mandracchia
Reviews.Content: We always thought that Sharp was a great brand.  Not anymore.... We bought this Sharp TV for Christmas last year.  The picture was great.  Then about 4 months ago the sound started to go out on us for several minutes at a time, and then it would come back on.  The intervals of no sound became longer and longer, until we had no sound for 1 - 2 hours, and then it would come back on.  We thought it was FIOS's fault.  Then I switched this set and the one in the bedroom.  The Sharp set still had no sound.  It is defective, and is also the last Sharp product that we will buy.  I refuse to pay for shipping to repair it, so into the garbage it goes.  You can be sure of one thing......the new set will not be a Sharp.

Reviews.Title: Decent HD Television.
Reviews.Author: Rhys in Seattle
Reviews.Content: Arrived quickly as described; an easy-to-use & value-priced HDTV! Works great with HDMI cable and digital antenna. Good picture. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: So-So
Reviews.Author: CRAGER
Reviews.Content: The picture is okay and the sound is not so okay. I knew the sound was going to be a tin-can from all the reviews I've read, but it was a little worse than I expected. The tin-can sound is worse when the Surround-Sound option is on (yes I turned the bass waaaay up and treble down).The picture as a computer monitor is fair at best. For XBOX 360 with HDMI it's also fair, and I have yet to hook up the cable box so really see how this TV works. It has a coax input on the back but will not work with my cable box. Might be that I'm trying to run two TV's off that box.The menu options are easy to navigate and the remote is nice, not like some of these real cheap crap TV's.For the price the TV is okay, nothing to really brag about, but it will work.

Reviews.Title: Sharp but not cutting edge
Reviews.Author: Wesley H. Rose
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a replacement TV. It was an inexpensive (less than $250 HDTV) substitute for a 27 inch Sony Trinitron. The 9:16 aspect ratio covers less area than the Sony's 3:4 CRT.The 5w speakers are too underpowered for action movie audio sound effects. The picture colors are washed-out. It does give a sharp picture when the object/subject motions are slow or still.

Reviews.Title: USB only plays MPEG
Reviews.Author: AngrySquirrel
Reviews.Content: Overall this tv is not bad.  But, today a lot of people use USB drives instead of DVD's to play movies to reduce the wear on the DVD.  This particular tv only plays MPEG format movies.  This means for 95% of the shows you would like to watch, you would have to convert them from AVI or whatever the format.  This gets annoying quickly.  So 5 stars if you are just looking for a screen and 2 stars if you are looking to utilizes the USB for anything other than pictures (yes you can display pictures).

Reviews.Title: Good picture....bad sound....
Reviews.Author: nhu
Reviews.Content: Worked out of the box, easy to set up but the sound is really poor. Adjusting the treble and bass did nothing. Just really BAD sound quality. I would so like to go back and pick a different tv.

Reviews.Title: Fair item for the price
Reviews.Author: Davidtechmech
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV to replace a old analog set that had seen its better days. In general this TV looks and works good  except for the sound. At maximum volume it is almost impossible to hear  what is going on the TV. ( Admittedly I do have a major hearing loss. so I will be  forced to buy a sound system to attach to this TV so that I can enjoy it.)  Did not have this problem  with the analog set had  plenty of volume  to it.

Reviews.Title: XBox 360 HDCP nightmare
Reviews.Author: Mr. Matthew J. Ghali
Reviews.Content: Not a bad looking display, and it was an easy job to set up. All worked fine using it with my XBox until I tried Netflix. I'd get black screen dropouts, the Netflix app would suddenly close, or claim I was signed out of XBL. Or the TV would claim "No signal!" or "Unsupported". Looking online, it seems like this happens to lots of folks. I also had the same intermittent problems watching TV via Windows Media Center on the XBox.I ended up returning this TV because of these constant HDCP hiccups. Sometimes it would recover by itself in a few seconds. Sometimes selecting another input source and going back fixed it. Sometimes I needed to power cycle the TV, and sometimes I needed to power cycle both the TV and XBox.The best part of this whole experience is that because I spent time researching the problem and trying many different solutions (new cables, software/firmware updates, even swapping out the XBox for a different hardware rev) I went over Amazon's 30-day return window by less than 24 hours. Now they refuse to take it back and give me a refund. Be careful! If you start to see problems, send it back ASAP! Amazon is pretty ruthless with their return window. This is the last time I'll try fixing a purchase instead of sending it back immediately.This TV is a great deal for a 26", ONLY if you don't require HDCP. For any HDMI source (or DVI requiring HDCP) you should definitely find a different display.I bought this one to replace a Samsung that had a less annoying HDCP bug, so probably avoid Samsung as well as Sharp. The replacement for this Sharp is a Panasonic Viera TC-L32U3 32-Inch 1080p LCD (ASIN: B004M8SC92). It has an IPS lcd panel which looks a million times better, is bigger, and was only about $50 more. No HDCP problems with it so far at all. Unfortunately, it looks like Amazon stopped selling this model. The other 32" Panasonic available is only 720p, so be careful!UPDATE: 2 months on the Panasonic, and not a single problem. And it's a gorgeous looking picture! Much MUCH happier.
